item.title: Getting a skeleton up and running
item.description: I was going to make my firt post “what is a path tracer anyway?”, but part of the point of this project is to learn exactly that by doing. So instead, let’s start somewhere a bit more practical. Getting a skeleton up and running Setup To develop this project, I’m personally using vscode’s in-docker development features. This essentially means spinning up a custom docker image for all development so that anything installed is nicely isolated from your host system.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, punter This blog is to document my progress having fun experimenting with writing path tracing systems with Rust. Initially inspired by smallpt, my main goals are to: have fun, learn to write good Rust, learn more about graphics programming in general and path tracing in particular. If you’ve stumbled across this I hope you can find it interesting and that I haven’t abandoned the project. The name Nothing special, just a silly tripartite portmanteu of “Path Tracing”, “Rust”, and “fUN”.
